name: undramatized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not described, shown, or performed as part of a book, play, film, etc.: The book leaves key situations undramatised, so relationships seem confusing, though in the end they become more or less clear.
literature
  specialized An undramatized narrator is someone who tells the story in a book without appearing as a character in it: The undramatised narrator is someone who, on the surface, is difficult to distinguish from the author.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the middle section, the film develops layers, and the director achieves something extraordinary: She dramatizes the undramatized.The narrator is undramatized in the text, and he and the implied author may be considered as one mind.Undramatized narrators tell the story without being seen, showing the action through the eyes of the characters so as to remain out of sight.
